perturbation.original_text: “Customer” means any Person that is a customer of the Distributor and any Affiliate of Distributor that has an interest in or ultimately utilizes the Product (as defined below).
perturbation.changed_text: “Customer” means any Person that directly purchases products from the Distributor.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition included affiliates of the Distributor who utilize the Product, broadening the scope of 'Customer.' The modified definition restricts 'Customer' to only those directly purchasing, potentially excluding end-users who are affiliates. This creates ambiguity as to whether sales to affiliates count toward performance benchmarks or revenue sharing, conflicting with standard business interpretations of 'customer' which often include end-users.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract; Texas Business Law - Ambiguity in contract interpretation

“Performance Benchmarks” shall mean the following requirements necessary for Distributor to maintain the exclusivity granted in Section 2.1 hereof: (a) the execution of contracts to deploy Products in 25 new locations approved in advance by Hydraspin (“Customer Locations”) during each 12 month period following the Effective Date and (b) all Customer Locations in the aggregate shall generate an average of 7,500 barrels of fluid per day on a trailing 12 month basis. Customer Locations must be available for installation within 90 days of approval by Hydraspin to be applied toward the satisfaction of the Performance Benchmark. All Customer Locations in excess of
2
perturbation.changed_text:
“Performance Benchmarks” shall mean requirements which Distributor must attempt to meet to maintain the exclusivity granted in Section 2.1 hereof: (a) Distributor must try to execute contracts to deploy Products and (b) all locations shall try to generate barrels of fluid per day on a trailing 12 month basis. Customer Locations should be available for installation within a reasonable time of approval by Hydraspin. All Customer Locations in excess of
2
perturbation.explanation: The original text sets firm requirements with specific numbers. The modified text changes 'shall mean the following requirements' to 'shall mean requirements which Distributor must attempt to meet', introduces subjective terms ('try,' 'should,' 'reasonable time') and removes the specific quantifiable benchmarks (25 locations, 7,500 barrels, 90 days). This weakens the obligations and creates ambiguity, making enforcement uncertain, and contradicting typical contract law requirements for clarity.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract; Texas Business Law - Lack of definiteness in essential terms

perturbation.original_text:
4.7 Problem Identification. During the term of this Agreement, Distributor shall provide Hydraspin with written notice of any claim or legal proceeding in the Territory involving any of the Products promptly after Distributor has actual knowledge of such claim or legal proceeding. Likewise, during the term of this Agreement, Hydraspin shall provide Distributor with written notice of any claim or legal proceeding in the Territory involving any of the Products promptly after Hydraspin has actual knowledge of such claim or legal proceeding. Distributor will also keep Hydraspin informed as to any problems encountered with any of the Products. Hydraspin
will repair or replace all defective or damaged Products at the time of delivery at its sole cost and expense.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.7 Problem Identification. During the term of this Agreement, Distributor may provide Hydraspin with written notice of any potential claim or legal proceeding. Distributor might keep Hydraspin informed as to any problems encountered with any of the Products. Hydraspin will consider repair or replacement of defective or damaged Products.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates notification of claims and guarantees repair/replacement of defective products. The modified version replaces 'shall provide' with 'may provide,' 'will also keep' with 'might keep,' and 'will repair or replace' with 'will consider repair or replacement.' This transforms the obligation into a discretionary option, creating uncertainty and contradicting standard interpretations of warranty and notification clauses in commercial agreements, potentially conflicting with implied warranty laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract; Texas Business Law - Implied Warranty
